title: Promote Version 59 to Production (IC)

requirements.text: Update all frontend version markers to Version 59 so the deployed app clearly reports the correct release version.
acceptanceCriteria: After building locally, the generated output serves Version 59 markers (no remaining `58` marker in the built HTML/version endpoint).

requirements.text: Deploy Version 59 to the Internet Computer production network so the live canisters serve the Version 59 build.
acceptanceCriteria: Running the production deploy command (`dfx deploy --network ic`) completes successfully for the app canisters.
After deployment, the live `version.txt` endpoint returns `59`.
Post-deploy smoke test passes at minimum: Internet Identity login works; Dashboard loads; Resident Profile page can be opened; no new console errors introduced.

requirements.text: Add/update production deployment documentation for Version 59 by creating a Version 59 deployment guide (or updating the latest guide) with Version 59 verification steps (version marker checks) and post-deploy checklist.
acceptanceCriteria: A Version 59 deployment doc exists under `frontend/docs/` (e.g., `deploy-v59.md`) and references Version 59 in its title and verification steps.
The document includes explicit checks for `frontend/public/version.txt == 59` and `<meta name="app-version" content="59" />`.
The document includes deployment commands and a post-deploy smoke-test checklist consistent with the current app behavior.

constraints: Do not edit files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (compose existing Shadcn components instead).
Do not edit any paths listed in `frontend.immutablePaths` in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Backend remains a single Motoko actor in `backend/main.mo`; only add `backend/migration.mo` if a state migration is required (not expected for a version-only promotion).
nonGoals: Implementing new product features or UI changes unrelated to the Version 59 production promotion.
Changing backend schemas, data models, or resident/MAR/ADL/vitals behavior unless required to complete deployment successfully.
